Moraware servers, backups, and disasters Moraware security – what’s your biggest risk? The boring work of keeping software running

articles.title: Systemize API Documentation
articles.content: Systemize API Documentation The Systemize application programming interface (API) allows programmers to write custom software to interact with your Systemize data. For information and to get started developing with the API, visit the Moraware API Documentation site, on the Moraware Developer site.

articles.title: Two-Factor Authentication & The Systemize API
articles.content: Two-Factor Authentication & The Systemize API When using integrations outside of Moraware, a User account specifically designated for using the Moraware API is recommended. Admin Users should not be used for API integrations. If your current API integration User has the role of Administrator, change the role to one that includes API access, but not Admin privileges. API Users can not enable Two-Factor Authentication without disruption to API integrations. Before enabling Two-Factor Authentication, check that the User is not the one designated for using the API. Do not enable Two-Factor Authentication on the API integration User. If the current API integration User is also an active Admin User, create a separate Admin User, then change the API User to a Role that includes API access. CREATE A NEW ADMIN USER You must be logged in as an Admin User to create or edit other Users. Go to Settings > Users & Roles > Users > Create. Complete the details for the new User, set the Role to Administrator > then Save. VERIFY A ROLE WITH API ACCESS Before changing the permissions of a User, check that the Role includes all the access that individual will need. In this case, a Role with API permission. If there is no suitable Role to add API permission, create a new one from the top menu bar. Go to Settings > Users & Roles > Roles. Click on a Role and scroll to the Administration section > make sure Execute is checked for API Requests. CHANGE API USER ROLE FROM ADMIN TO API REQUESTS You must be logged in as an Admin User to create or edit other User Roles. Go to Settings > Users & Roles > Users > click on the name of the User to edit. Select the appropriate Role under Permissions.

articles.title: What is Moraware Inventory?
articles.content: What is Moraware Inventory? Moraware Inventory lets you order, receive, allocate, and consume slabs and sinks. Inventory is a product that ties into Systemize, similar to CounterGo. Linking Inventory and Systemize allows for Material and Sinks to be connected to a Job Activity within a specific Job. This connection allows you to: Know which Slabs to order and when. Eliminate unnecessary extra orders. Have Slabs and Sinks tied to Jobs. Make sure what is ordered matches what is received. Keep everything in one place, providing visibility and transparency. Know the date Slabs are ordered, received, and used. There are two primary groups of fabricators that use Moraware Inventory. On Demand users only order material once a Job is confirmed. Warehouse users keep stock inventory in their yards.

articles.title: On Demand Inventory
articles.content: On Demand Inventory Some customers follow an On Demand pattern to their stone inventory. Typically once a customer commits to a Job, stone is ordered. When it arrives it's allocated to that Job and consumed. Very little stone is kept in stock, mostly from remnants or canceled Jobs. If this sounds like your workflow, add a few Suppliers and a Purchase Order Form, then create a test Job to step through ordering, receiving, and consuming slabs.

articles.title: Warehouse Inventory
articles.content: Warehouse Inventory Some customers keep significant amounts of stone on hand. Quantities are determined on a regular basis, then ordered and received, allowing for customers to browse and select stone from stock before confirming a Job. Material is assigned from stock once a Job is confirmed. That allocated Material is consumed, leftover remnants may be placed back into stock. If this sounds like your workflow, add a few Suppliers and a Purchase Order Form. Create an order and receive slabs, then create a test Job to step through allocating and consuming slabs.

articles.title: Allocate, Order, Receive & Consume First Slabs
articles.content: Allocate, Order, Receive & Consume First Slabs Are you ready to Allocate, Order, Receive, and Consume slabs in Inventory? Select a completed Job in Systemize, or, create a test Job to walk through the process. This sample steps through the entire Allocate to Consume process. There is usually a gap between ordering, receiving and consuming, and you'll find there are multiple areas to Order, Receive, and Consume Material in Inventory. ALLOCATE SLABS In Systemize, create a test Job or select an existing Job. On the Job Details page, click Edit Material in the Material column for the Activity that is associated with the Slabs. Click Add Wanted Slabs across from Allocated Slabs. ORDER SLABS Create a Purchase Order by clicking on the Order button. Select the Wanted Slabs, then click Order and select a Supplier to create a New Purchase Order. On the Purchase Order page that opens, Close Order to indicate the Material has been ordered. A Purchase Order must be Closed before it can be Received or printed. A Closed PO can be re-opened. Closing the PO only indicated that items have been Ordered. It does not complete the order. RECEIVE SLABS Go to a Slabs View by clicking Slabs from the left side navigation. Click the Receive button to change the Slab Status to On-Hand. CONSUME SLABS From a Slab View, click on the name of the Allocated Job. Click the Consume button from the top navigation, select the Material, then click Consume again.

articles.title: Add Materials And Sinks To The Product List
articles.content: Add Materials And Sinks To The Product List Do you have Slabs and Sinks sold often, but don't need to add them as On-Hand? Add them to the Product List to quickly create Purchase Orders in the future. Moraware Inventory has a list of the most commonly sold Materials (Slabs) and their Colors available to select. Custom Materials can also be added. Enable Cost Groups and Costs to organize Products. Go to Settings > Products List > Edit Product List. Go to Materials > Add Material > Select a Material or enter a Custom Material. Add or delete any Colors, one name per line. Edit Any Slab size by clicking on the name. Or add Slab Sizes by clicking Add Size. Add additional Colors by clicking the Add icon. Delete a Color by clicking the Delete icon next to an individual Color. Save the Product List.

articles.title: Add Sinks & Costs
articles.content: Add Sinks & Costs Sink brands, Models and Costs can be added to the Product List. The Cost field can be left blank and added later when creating a Purchase Order. Go to Settings > Product Lists > Edit Product List. Click on Sinks > Add Sink Brand > enter brand Name. To add Sink Models, click Add Models > enter one Name per line. Enter Cost for each Model, then Save the Product List.

articles.title: Create A Remnant
articles.content: Create A Remnant If there are useable leftover pieces after cutting a Slab for a Job, create a Remnant to keep that Material available. Create a Remnant after the Job Activity is completed and the Material is marked Consumed in Inventory. Remnants can be created from Slab Views or by clicking on Allocated Material in the Job Activity in Systemize. Remnants can also be created for leftover pieces that are not associated with a Job via Reconcile Slabs. You must be an Admin User to create Remnants from Reconcile Slabs. Remnants are assigned a status of On-Hand once they are created and can be allocated to other Job Activities. Images can be added to Remnants to help identify them. CREATE A REMNANT WHEN JOB MATERIAL IS CONSUMED From any Slab View, click on the Job Name with a completed Activity. Click the Consume button > select the Material to Consume > click the Consume button. Click on the Material Status > click the Split Slab icon > select Add Remnant. By default the original Full Slab information is listed as the first Piece, along with the Job Activity and Date. Enter the dimensions of the Remnants under Unallocated. To copy any of the Details from the original Slab, check the box in the Details column. Leave unchecked to enter new or information or to leave blank. Save, or click the Add Piece icon to add additional Remnants. CREATE A REMNANT NOT ASSOCIATED WITH A JOB OR EXISTING MATERIAL Go to Settings > Reconcile Slabs > Start Reconciling > Click the On-Hand button. Enter the necessary details, and under Size, select Remnant, then enter the dimensions. Click Add.

articles.title: Add Suppliers
articles.content: Add Suppliers Ready to add Suppliers to Inventory? Adding Suppliers is necessary before you can create a Purchase Order for Slabs or Sinks. You must have Administrator privileges to make these changes. If you are not, contact the Admin User in your company. Go to Settings > Purchase Order Settings > Suppliers. Click Create from the top menu. Add the Supplier's Name and an Account Number if necessary.

articles.title: Video: Where To Find Inventory Answers
articles.content: Video: Where To Find Inventory Answers TRANSCRIPT: Hi. Are you looking for help with Inventory? Every Inventory user has free and unlimited access to the Inventory Knowledge Base, and can email or call our friendly Inventory experts. Each Moraware product has a direct link to its Knowledge Base. From the left side navigation, click Help, then SEARCH HELP Or type inventoryhelp.moraware.com into any browser. The Knowledge Base is divided into categories, or type a word or phrase into the search bar. Still can’t find what you need? Or prefer to talk with us? Send a message directly from where you are; email support@moraware.com, or give us a call at 866-312-9273. We are available 8AM to 4PM Pacific Time, Monday through Friday.

articles.title: Where To Find Inventory Answers
articles.content: Where To Find Inventory Answers Are you looking for help with Inventory? Not sure where to start or if there is a fee? The Knowledge Base is divided into categories, click on any category to open. Type a word or phrase into the search bar to narrow down topics. articles.title: Create & Print Inventory Labels
articles.content: Create & Print Inventory Labels Slab Labels can now be created and printed in Moraware Inventory from the Slabs page, in Purchase Orders, or when viewing individual Slab information. Anytime the Label icon is visible, Slab Labels can be printed. At least one Label Form, under Settings > Labels, must be created before printing, to specify what information to print, individual label size, row/column print order, and number of labels per sheet. See the related article Create & Edit Label Forms for detailed steps. Click on the Label icon. Check the Slabs, indicating quantity if necessary > click the Label icon again. Select the Label Form to use. When printing Labels from a fresh label sheet, leave the Start Label number at 1. If using a partial sheet for printing, determine the location to Start Label based on the number of labels per sheet and the direction of printing, rows then columns or columns then rows. Click Print > follow your computer and printer dialogs for further instructions.

articles.title: Create & Edit Inventory Label Forms
articles.content: Create & Edit Inventory Label Forms Slab Label Forms are used to print Slab Labels. Create Label Forms to match pre-cut adhesive label sheets, or print on plain paper. Define different Label Forms for different label sheets, Slab Material, or paper, however you organize and label your Slabs. After a Label Form has been created, it can be edited at any time by clicking on the underlined Label Form Name under Settings > Labels. CREATE A LABEL FORM Go to Settings > Labels. Click the Create Label Form button from the top navigation > enter a Name. Click the Edit icon across from Label Info to enter Label Size and Layout Dimensions. Select to draw a border around each individual Label if necessary > Save. Click the Add icon across from Fields > Select a Data Type from the listed options > next to Name select Fields to include from the drop-down list, or click the Multiple button to choose several at once > Save. Click, hold, and drag individual Form Fields to rearrange them within the Label area. EDIT FORM FIELDS Go to Settings > Labels > click on the Name of the Label Form to edit. Use the Edit, Add, or Delete icons next to each area to make changes. After clicking Save in individual areas, the changes have been saved for the entire Form. Use the side and top navigation to return to Inventory.

articles.title: Video: How To Re-Order Items In Moraware Inventory Products
articles.content: Video: How To Re-Order Items In Moraware Inventory Products TRANSCRIPT: Are you wondering how to change the order of how some items display in Moraware products? Whenever a lists displays sequence numbers and they're underlined, they can be clicked on to change the order where they're displayed. I'll click on any underlined number, then click, hold on the double arrow icon, and move the selection up or down. Moving up will result in a lower number or a higher display position. Moving down a larger number and a lower display position. This functionality is the same in CounterGo, Systemize, and Moraware Inventory. You can find this video, and other helpful info, in the CounterGo, Systemize, and Moraware Inventory Knowledge Bases.Or get in touch with one of our friendly support experts at support@moraware.com.

articles.title: Video: Auto-Generate Serial Numbers
articles.content: Video: Auto-Generate Serial Numbers TRANSCRIPT: Welcome to Inventory Serial Numbers. This video will show you where and how to set the start of a Serial Number sequence, add, or generate Serial Numbers, and how to search for specific Serial Numbers.From the left side navigation, click on Settings. Then Next Slab Serial Number. This page always displays what number will be used next for auto generation. At the top, click on the Edit icon to enter a different number for the system to use next in the sequence. O nly numbers can be used for auto generation. No letters, dashes, or special characters.For flexibility, Serial Numbers can be added at several points in Moraware Inventory. You'll find the option when receiving Slabs, in Purchase Orders, and when viewing Slab Information.From a Slab View, click on the Slab Status to edit Slab information. If there's only one Slab, the option to enter or generate a Serial Number will appear. If there's more than one Slab, click the Set Serial Numbers button.You can auto generate all the numbers, manually enter all, or use a combination of both. Manually entered Serial Numbers, can use numbers, letters, dashes, and special characters.When numbers are autogenerated, the system checks existing numbers and will not assign a duplicate.When manually entering a Serial Number duplicates can be used. This functionality exists so that partial Slabs can have the same Serial Number as the original Slab they were cut from.Serial Numbers in Inventory can also be searched. Type the number in the Search bar, then select from the suggested options. For a full view, use the Search icon, or tap enter on the keyboard for a quick summary view.You can find this video, and other helpful information, in the Inventory knowledge base. If you'd like to get in touch with one of our friendly Inventory experts, email support@moraware.com.

articles.title: Video: Split & Allocate Slabs
articles.content: Video: Split & Allocate Slabs TRANSCRIPT: Slabs in Moraware Inventory can be split when allocated, when a full slab is not needed. Open a Systemize Job that is ready to have Material allocated. Click in the Material column of the Job Activity to allocate Material. Select to Add Slabs from Inventory. I’m using Desert Dream Granite for this Job, so I’ll use the filters, then refresh, to narrow down what’s displayed. This Job needs one and a half slabs. Select the Material slabs, and enter a decimal number, in this case 1.5, then add the Material to the Job. The remaining piece of a Slab does not have to be allocated immediately. Pieces split from Slabs remain in On-Hand Inventory for use later. There is another Job that needs only a half slab, let’s allocate it now. Open the Job, click in the Material column and select Add Slab From Inventory. I’ll filter for Desert Dream Granite, refresh the view, and allocate the remaining half slab. If you have questions, the Inventory Knowledge Base has lots of helpful resources. Or email one of our friendly Inventory experts at support@moraware.com. Thanks for stopping by.

articles.title: What's New: Filter On-Hand Reports By Allocation
articles.content: What's New: Filter On-Hand Reports By Allocation TRANSCRIPT: Wondering what’s new? On-Hand Reports in Moraware Inventory can now be filtered by Allocation status. Choose to display either On-Hand material already Allocated to Jobs, or On-Hand Material that is Unallocated, and available to be assigned. For more information, visit the Inventory Knowledge Base. Or get in touch with one of our friendly Inventory experts at support@moraware.com. Thanks for stopping by!

articles.title: What’s New: Updated Help & Contact Us
articles.content: What’s New: Updated Help & Contact Us TRANSCRIPT: Wondering what's new? We've updated the Help menu in CounterGo, Systemize, and Moraware Inventory.In addition to contact numbers, there's links to knowledge base articles and videos, to email us, schedule a call, and a link for screen sharing while on a call, all in one convenient location.If you have questions, reach out to our friendly experts at support@moraware.com. Thanks for stopping by.

articles.title: What's New: Create Inventory Labels
articles.content: What's New: Create Inventory Labels TRANSCRIPT: Wondering what’s new? Slab labels can now be created in Moraware Inventory from the Slabs page, in Purchase Orders, or when viewing individual Slab information. Create Label Forms specifying what information to print, individual label size, and number of labels per sheet. For more information, visit the Inventory Knowledge Base. articles.content: What's New: Inventory Serial Numbers TRANSCRIPT: Wondering what’s new? Enter or generate Serial numbers for slabs in Moraware Inventory when receiving material, or when viewing individual slab details. Generate the next available number in a sequence, from the start point you set, manually enter unique numbers, or use a combination of both. For more information, visit the Inventory Knowledge Base. Or get in touch with one of our friendly Inventory experts at support@moraware.com. Thanks for stopping by!

articles.title: What's New: Filter Inventory Views By Thickness Or Finish
articles.content: What's New: Filter Inventory Views By Thickness Or Finish TRANSCRIPT: Wondering what's new? Slab Views can now be customized and filtered by Thickness or Finish. Save the view for quick access later. For more information, visit the Inventory Knowledge Base. Or get in touch with one of our friendly Inventory experts at support@moraware.com. Thanks for stopping by.

articles.title: What's New: Inventory Two-Factor Authentication Login
articles.content: What's New: Inventory Two-Factor Authentication Login TRANSCRIPT: Hi, wondering what’s new? Two-factor Authentication at login is available in all Moraware products. While enabling the feature is not required, it's the best way to prevent unauthorized access to User accounts. If a User works in multiple Moraware products with the same login, enabling it in any product will activate it for all products. Users can select to use the Authenticator app of their choice. If you have questions, check out the Moraware product Knowledge Bases. Or get in touch with one of our friendly experts at support@moraware.com. Thanks for stopping by!

articles.title: What's New: Cancel A Purchase Order
articles.content: What's New: Cancel A Purchase Order TRANSCRIPT: Hi, Moraware has added a new feature. Moraware Inventory now has the ability to cancel Purchase Orders. But be advised , canceling a Purchase Order is permanent and cannot be undone. A Purchase Order can be canceled anytime it has Open status. Is the Purchase Order already closed? Reopen it first and then cancel. If a Purchase Order with Allocated Materials or Sinks is canceled, there is there is the option to delete the Product, or keep it as Wanted. Canceling Purchase Order is permanent and cannot be undone. If you have questions, the Inventory Knowledge Base has lots of helpful articles and videos. Or email one of our friendly Inventory experts at support@moraware.com. Thanks for stopping by.

articles.title: What's New: Search Serial Numbers
articles.content: What's New: Search Serial Numbers TRANSCRIPT: Hi, wondering what’s new? Now you can search for Serial Numbers in Moraware Inventory. If you have questions, check out the Inventory Knowledge Base. Or get in touch with one of our friendly Inventory experts at support@moraware.com. Thanks for stopping by!

articles.title: What's New: Add Serial Numbers When Receiving Slabs
articles.content: What's New: Add Serial Numbers When Receiving Slabs TRANSCRIPT: Hi, wondering what's new? Serial Numbers can now be added when Slabs are received in Moraware Inventory. In addition to adding Serial Numbers by clicking on a Slab Status, they can also be assigned when the Slabs are being Received. After selecting the Slabs to Receive, click the Edit icon across from Serial Numbers and enter a serial number for each Slab. Apply the numbers, then complete the action by Receiving the slabs. If you have questions, the Inventory Knowledge Base has helpful articles and videos. Or email one of our friendly Inventory experts at support@moraware.com. Thanks for stopping by.

articles.title: What's New: Updated Customize Filters
articles.content: What's New: Updated Customize Filters TRANSCRIPT Hi! Wondering what’s new? The display of the Customize filter fields in Moraware Inventory has been updated. You can see the changes in any View where the Customize button appears. If you have questions, check out the Inventory Knowledge Base. Or get in touch with one of our friendly Inventory experts at support@moraware.com. Thanks for stopping by!

articles.content: What's New: Split & Allocate Slabs TRANSCRIPT: Wondering what’s new? Moraware Inventory Slabs can now be split when only part of a Slab is needed. Enter a decimal amount when allocating Material for pieces less than a full slab. If you have questions, the Inventory Knowledge Base has lots of helpful resources. Or email one of our friendly Inventory experts at support@moraware.com. Thanks for stopping by.

articles.title: What's New: Inventory Slab Images
articles.content: What's New: Inventory Slab Images TRANSCRIPT: Hi, wondering what’s new? Thumbnail images can now be added to Slabs and Remnants in Moraware Inventory. The image column displays in Slab Views, Job Activity pages, individual Purchase Order pages, and when adding On-Hand or Wanted Material. If you have questions, the Inventory Knowledge Base has lots of helpful resources. Or email one of our friendly Inventory experts at support@moraware.com. Thanks for stopping by!

articles.title: What's New: Reconcile Inventory
articles.content: What's New: Reconcile Inventory TRANSCRIPT: Hi, wondering what’s new? Moraware Inventory now has a Reconcile feature that allows you to view, add or remove on-hand Slabs and Sinks in your shop, all in one place in your Moraware database. The Reconcile View can be customized, and Slabs and Sinks can be added using the On-Hand button, or deleted with the delete icon. Removing Slabs and Sinks by deleting them can not be undone, only Users with Administrator Roles have access to the Reconcile feature. If you have questions, the Inventory Knowledge Base has lots of helpful articles and videos. Or email one of our friendly Inventory experts at support@moraware.com. Thanks for stopping by.

articles.title: What's New: Moraware Inventory
articles.content: What's New: Moraware Inventory TRANSCRIPT: Are you looking for a solution for managing Material and Sinks used in Jobs? Moraware Inventory ties into Systemize, similar to CounterGo, and lets you order, receive, allocate, and consume Slabs and Sinks in Systemize Jobs. Linking Inventory and Systemize allows for Material and Sinks to be connected to a Job Activity within specific Jobs. This connection allows you to know which Slabs to order and when, eliminate unnecessary extra orders, have Slabs and Sinks tied to Jobs, make sure what is ordered, matches what is received, and know the date Slabs are ordered, received, and used. To learn more, visit the Inventory Knowledge Base. Or if you're ready to add Inventory, email sales@moraware.com. Thanks for stopping by.

articles.title: What’s New: Moraware Recap Fall 2024
articles.content: What’s New: Moraware Recap Fall 2024 TRANSCRIPT: Hi, I'm Chelsea. Wondering what we've been doing behind the screen? Our development team is consistently working to update Moraware Systemize, Inventory, and CounterGo to provide you with the best experience for managing your business. From keeping your system secure, managing larger jobs, and making it easier to use Moraware products, here's a quick recap of just a few of the most recent feature updates. Let's start with an important topic, no matter what Moraware product you use. We've enhanced the security of your database and information with Two Factor Authentication at login. Enabling the feature is not required, but highly recommended since it's the best way to prevent unauthorized access to your account. Systemize Phases are a helpful way to break up larger Jobs and schedule smaller blocks of work separately. When viewing Job Details, the new Phase Filter option allows for selecting and viewing all Activities, Forms, Orders, and uploaded Files related to the Phase or Phases selected. This means less scrolling and easier visibility of only the information you need. For Systemize users who also use Moraware Inventory, recent enhancements allow for Serial Numbers to be searched to find specific slabs easier. Three new features in CounterGo make it easier to quote larger Jobs. Line item only Quotes Without Drawings can now be created. Quotes Without Drawings are helpful to quickly total square footage, especially when a drawing and measurements have already been provided. Square feet, or measurements, along with Curves, Bump outs, Splash, Edge, Sinks, and Cutouts can all quickly be added without creating a Drawing. CounterGo now has the option to create one drawing and then multiply the Quantities of the area in Step 6, making it faster to create multi-unit Quotes that use the same countertop layouts. Page Breaks can now be added to the Drawing Area when printing Quotes, making it easier to read larger or more complex layouts. This feature works best when printed or emailed with a Quote & Order form that has the Drawing Area set to the full width, like the built-in Quote With Large Drawing Form. Additional Countergo improvements were released to make Quoting and Drawing easier and more intuitive. Starting with Pan and Zoom when drawing, keyboard arrow shortcuts have been added when using the Pan feature. Use the Shift key and the mouse to Pan without selecting it from the side menu. Zoom now anchors to the center of the drawing space and works using a magic mouse, mouse with a scroll wheel, two finger touch on a trackpad, or keyboard plus and minus shortcuts. Waterfall and Miters can now be applied to non standard edges.Those that are segmented have bump outs or bump ins, notched or clipped corners. As with standard waterfalls and miters, the amount of Material required, as well as a charge for the two cuts between the pieces, is automatically calculated. The last CounterGo feature to highlight is the ability to add the Total Price as a Display Column in Quote Views. We're pleased to have added these new product features and updates to provide you with an improved Moraware experience. If you have any questions, reach out to our friendly Moraware Support Team at support@moraware.com.Thanks for stopping by!

articles.title: Reports - Slabs
articles.content: Reports - Slabs Inventory offers basic Reports for quick totals On-Hand Slabs. Filter and select Display options by using the Customize button. Reports can be filtered by Material, Color, Remnants, and Supplier. By default the Date is set to today, or a Specific Date can be selected. The Report can also be customized to also show Thickness, Size, Suppliers, as well as how many rows to display per page. Once customized, Save the View for quick access later. Go to Reports > Select Slabs On-Hand. Click the Customize button > Select any Filters and Display options.

articles.title: Save Report Views
articles.content: Save Report Views Ready to save Report Views? Views can be customized and saved for quick access. Shared Views are accessible to all Inventory Users in your database. My Views are only accessible to the User name/password that saves the View. Checking Make This My Default View will pull that view up by default when a Report type is selected from the main Reports menu. Go to Reports > Select A Report > Customize. Select Filters and any additional columns to Display. Click Save View > enter a View Name > select View Type > Save the View.

articles.title: Reports - Sinks
articles.content: Reports - Sinks Inventory offers basic Reports for quick totals of On-Hand Sinks. Filter and select Display options by using the Customize button. Reports can be filtered by Brand, Model, and Supplier. By default the Date is set to today, or a Specific Date can be selected. The Report can also be customized to also show Suppliers as well as how many rows to display per page. Once customized, Save the View for quick access later. Go to Reports > select a Report > Customize. Click the Customize button > Select any Filters and options to Display.

articles.title: Save Slab & Sink Views
articles.content: Save Slab & Sink Views Ready to save Slab Views? Views can be customized and saved for quick access. Shared Views are accessible to all Inventory Users in your database. My Views are only accessible to the User name/password that saves the View. Checking Make This My Default View will pull that view up by default when Slabs is selected form the left side navigation. Go to Slabs > Customize. Make selections for the View from the available options. Click Save View > enter a View Name. Select View Type > Save the View.

articles.title: Customize Reconcile Views
articles.content: Customize Reconcile Views Reconcile is an Admin-only feature in Inventory that allows you to manage On-Hand Products. Reconcile Slabs View can be customized to filter by Material, Color, Allocation, Locations, Supplier, or if the slab is a Remnant.Reconcile Sinks View can be filtered by Sink Brand, Sink Model, Allocation, Location, and Supplier. RECONCILE SLABS VIEW Go to Settings > Reconcile Slabs > click the Start Reconciling button. Click the Customize button > Select any necessary filters. RECONCILE SINKS VIEW Go to Settings > Reconcile Sinks > click the Start Reconciling button. Click the Customize button > Select any necessary filters.

articles.title: Slab View By Wanted Slabs
articles.content: Slab View By Wanted Slabs Slab Views can be customized in a variety of ways to display only the information needed. After customizing a View, save it for quick access later. This sample details how to create a Slab View by Wanted Slabs. Go to Slabs > Customize > Click the Add Filter icon. Select Status as the Filter Type > Wanted for the Status. Save the View for quick access later.

articles.title: Slab View By Material
articles.content: Slab View By Material Slab Views can be customized in a variety of ways to display only the information needed. After customizing a View, save it for quick access later. This sample details how to create a Slab View by Material. Go to Slabs > Customize > Click the Add Filter icon. Select Material as the Filter Type > Select a Material from the drop-down list. Save the View for quick access later.

articles.title: Customize Slab Views
articles.content: Customize Slab Views Slab Views can be customized to show different information in different Views. Once customized, Views can be saved for quick access later. Views can show Status, Product, Color, Allocation, Remnant or Full Slab, and Supplier. After applying Filters, save the View for quick access later. Go to Slabs > Customize > click the Add Filter icon. Select a Filter Type from the drop-down list > select the related sub options > Apply. Add another Filter using the steps above if needed > Apply.

articles.title: Slab View By Remnants
articles.content: Slab View By Remnants Slab Views can be customized in a variety of ways to display only the information needed. After customizing a View, save it for quick access later. This sample details how to create a Slab View by Remnants. Go to Slabs > Customize > Click the Add Filter icon. Select Remnant as the Filter Type > Select Remnants Only for Remnant. Save the View for quick access later.

articles.title: Slab View By Supplier
articles.content: Slab View By Supplier Slab Views can be customized in a variety of ways to display only the information needed. After customizing a View, save it for quick access later. This sample details how to create a Slab View by Supplier. Go to Slabs > Customize > Click the Add Filter icon. Select Supplier for the Filter Type > Select a Supplier from the drop-down list. Save the View for quick access later.

articles.title: Manage Inventory Roles
articles.content: Manage Inventory Roles Every Inventory User must have one and only one Role. By default the first Inventory User has Administrator privileges. Administrator Role: allows the User complete access, including creating/purchasing additional Users, changing passwords and accessing the Moraware billing portal. The Admin Role can be assigned to more than one User but it's not a good idea to make everyone an Admin. Create or edit Roles to designate access for different people within your organization. CREATE ROLES Go to Settings > Users & Roles > Roles. Click Create Role. Name the Role and provide a brief description. Check the appropriate permissions for the Role. EDIT ROLES Go to Settings > Users & Roles > Roles. Click on the Name of the Role to edit. Check or uncheck the appropriate permissions for the Role. ASSIGN ROLES Go to Settings > Users & Roles > Users. Click on the User Name. Select a Role from the drop-down list.

articles.title: Disable An Inventory User
articles.content: Disable An Inventory User Remove access to Inventory by disabling a User. This will maintain a record of all changes that User made previously, but they will not be able to log in going forward. There is no charge for Users who's Inventory access has been disabled. Go to Settings > Users & Roles > Users. Click on the Name of the User. Check the Disabled box to disable their Inventory access.

articles.title: Manage Inventory Users
articles.content: Manage Inventory Users Moraware Inventory Users are sold individually. An Inventory User must also be a Systemize User in order to allocate Material to Jobs in Systemize. Inventory Users can operate within multiple devices or browsers at the same time, only if they do not have CounterGo permission. Administrator permissions are required to make changes, add or delete Inventory Users. Change Logs can be accessed for all Users, or individual Users. MANAGE INVENTORY USERS Go to Settings > Users & Roles > Users. Click on the Name of any User listed to view their Change Log, or modify their User Name, Full Name, Email, Password, or Role. CREATE A NEW INVENTORY USER Go to Settings > Users & Roles > Users. Click on Create New User > select an existing Moraware User, or enter information for a new User. You will be charged for adding either type of User.

articles.title: Active Users VS Licensed Users After Disabling or Deleting An Inventory User
articles.content: Active Users VS Licensed Users After Disabling or Deleting An Inventory User When a User is removed from Inventory, the number of Active Users and Licensed Users may not match temporarily. The number of Active Users will show the revised count, and the number of Licensed Users will update at the end of the billing cycle. Active Users are users that currently have login access to Inventory. Licensed Users are how many licenses were originally purchased during that billing period. A Disabled or Deleted User does not have access to Inventory while their License is being removed.

articles.title: Inventory Two-Factor Authentication Login
articles.content: Inventory Two-Factor Authentication Login Two-factor Authentication at login is available in all Moraware products. While enabling the feature is not required, it's the best way to prevent unauthorized access to User accounts. Any User can enable or disable Two-Factor Authentication for their login only. Admin Users can remove Two-Factor Authentication from any User login. If a User works in multiple Moraware products with the same login, enabling it in any product will activate it for all products. Users can select to use any Authenticator app of their choice. Authenticator apps can be downloaded from either Android or Apple app stores. Failed Two-Factor Authentications do count as failed login attempts. ADD TWO-FACTOR AUTHENTICATION Click on your User Name in the left side navigation menu. Click Two-Factor Authentication > Setup > download an Authenticator App. Enter your Moraware password. Scan the QR code in the authenticator app of your choice > enter the code generated. REMOVE TWO-FACTOR AUTHENTICATION: INDIVIDUAL USER Click on your User Name in the left side navigation menu. Click Two-Factor Authentication > click the Turn Off button. REMOVE TWO-FACTOR AUTHENTICATION: ADMIN USER Go to Settings > Users & Roles > Users > Click on a Name. Click the Remove Two-Factor Authentication icon from the top menu bar.

articles.title: Change Your Email In Moraware Inventory
articles.content: Change Your Email In Moraware Inventory Do you need to change the Email Address you use in Moraware? Users with Administrator Roles can change the Email Address for themselves or other Users. If you have Moraware Systemize or CounterGo, changing your Email Address in Inventory will change it in those other products as well. The Email Address entered for a User is where a reset link will be sent if a User forgets their password. Go to Settings > Users & Roles > Users. Click on the User Name to edit. Enter the new Email Address > Save.

articles.title: Change Your User Name In Moraware Inventory
articles.content: Change Your User Name In Moraware Inventory Do you need to change the name you use to login to Moraware? Users with Administrator Roles can change the User Name for themselves or other Users. If you have Moraware Systemize or CounterGo, changing your User Name in Inventory will change it in those other products as well. Go to Settings > Users & Roles > Users. Click on the User Name to edit. Enter the new User Name > Save.

articles.title: Locked Out Of Moraware Inventory
articles.content: Locked Out Of Moraware Inventory Are you locked out of your Moraware account after failed login attempts? Admin Users can set minimums for session timeouts, login attempts, and time to auto-unlock. This article will list the defaults, your system settings may differ. The default of login attempts is 5, though your Admin may have increased or decreased this If you find yourself locked out due to incorrect logins, there are a few options to resolve the situation. RESET PASSWORD If you have an email associated with your account, click on " Forgot your password?" to have a reset link sent to you. AUTO UNLOCK Wait 15 minutes and try again. The default auto-unlock is 15 minutes, but your Admin may have set this to a longer or shorter amount of time. CONTACT YOUR ADMIN USER Contact an Admin User(s) for your database. This is someone in your company who has an Administrator Role. They can let you know how long to wait before you try logging again, or they can reset your password for you.

articles.title: Add A Systemize User To Moraware Inventory
articles.content: Add A Systemize User To Moraware Inventory Do you need to add an existing Systemize User to Moraware Inventory? An Inventory User must also be a Systemize User in order to allocate Material to Jobs in Systemize. Moraware Inventory Users are sold individually. Add the Systemize User while in Moraware Inventory. You will be charged for adding the Systemize User to Moraware Inventory. Go to Settings > Users & Roles > Users. Click on Create New User > select Add Existing Moraware User. Select the User to add > Select a Role > Save.

articles.title: Translate Moraware Inventory Articles To Other Languages
articles.content: Translate Moraware Inventory Articles To Other Languages Are you looking for articles in another language? Currently Moraware software and support content is in English only. There are several ways your browser can assist with translating what is on a web page. Listed below are options some of our customers have had good results using. We are pleased to suggest these work arounds, but any questions about using third-party software or extensions needs to be directed to the Help Centers for those products. CHROME Google Translate Extension - Add the extension to Chrome for quick access to Google Translate. Once the extension is added, click the Extensions Manager and pin Google Translate to the menu bar. Click the Google Translate extension icon and past a web page URL into the box. Google Translate - If you prefer not to add an extension to Chrome, translate a page using this site. Check that English is selected in the box on the left, select your preferred language above the field on the right. Copy and paste the URL of the page into the box the left then click the URL on the right to go to a translated page. Google Translate Help - translate web pages or documents. Google Chrome Language Settings - Change your language settings in Chrome to assist with translation. FIREFOX From the Firefox Browser Add-ons page, search for Translate Web Pages and Add To Firefox. There is an option to have the extension always translate web pages, or you can choose individually.

articles.title: Add Slab Images To Multiple Slab Bundle
articles.content: Add Slab Images To Multiple Slab Bundle Do you want to add a reference photo to a bundle of Slabs? Images must be added one at a time to a bundle. Select each Slab then add the image. This will result in each slab of the bundle appearing as an individual entry, no longer as a group. BEFORE YOU BEGIN: Save images of slabs on your computer or in a cloud storage location of your choice, naming images according to what they are, to make it easier to search later on. Save images as BMP, GIF, JPEG, or PNG formats. The limit on the size of the file to be uploaded is 30 MB. Click on the Status of the Slab or Remnant. Select an individual Slab from the total of the Total. Click the Add Image icon now available at the bottom of the box. Locate the image on your computer or cloud storage > Save. Repeat the process for each slab in the bundle.

articles.title: Split & Allocate Slabs
articles.content: Split & Allocate Slabs Slabs can be split into pieces to share between Jobs. When only part of a Slab is needed, enter a decimal amount when allocating Material. Slabs can be allocated from On-Hand Inventory, or designated as Wanted Material that must be ordered. When splitting Slabs, the remaining piece of a Slab does not have to be allocated immediately. Pieces split from On-Hand Slabs remain in On-Hand Inventory for use later. SPLIT ON-HAND SLABS Open a Systemize Job that is ready to have Material allocated. Click in the Material column of the Job Activity to allocate Material > select to Add Slabs From Inventory. Select Slabs and enter a decimal number for the Quantity > Add the Material to the Job. SPLIT WANTED SLABS Open a Systemize Job that is ready to have Material allocated. Click in the Material column of the Job Activity to allocate Material > select to Add Wanted Slabs. Enter the Quantity, using a decimal to split a Slab into pieces, Material, and Color > Add any additional Material Information. Add the Material to the Job.

articles.title: Create A Purchase Order
articles.content: Create A Purchase Order Purchase Orders can be created in three places in Moraware Inventory. Creating a Purchase Order from the Purchase Orders page is the only place where any Material or Sink can be added. Creating a Purchase Order from a Job Activity Page, in Systemize or Inventory, only allows for the Allocated Material or Sink to be included on the new Purchase Order. Use the Order button to create POs from these pages. A Purchase Order created from any Slab View will include Wanted Slabs or Sinks only. Once all items have been added to the Purchase Order, Close the PO to indicate that materials have been ordered. A Purchase Order must be marked Closed before it can be Received, or printed. Closed Purchase Orders can be re-opened. Go to POs > Create. Select a Supplier and Expected Date. Click Add Slab or Add Sink. On the Purchase Order page that opens, Close Order to indicate the Material has been ordered. This will allow for the items to be Received or printed.

articles.title: Add Materials With Different Finishes To The Product List
articles.content: Add Materials With Different Finishes To The Product List Do you sell the same Material in different finishes? Rename, then add Materials to the Product List again, to allow for the same Material with variations. By renaming the Material you can add it again. The steps below to show how to add Granite Polished and Granite Leathered to the Product List. Note: This will pull in all the built in Colors for that Material but will not copy any Costs or Color modifications already entered for the original. Go to Settings > Product List > Edit Product List. Click on the Name of the Material to edit. Change the Material Name, in this example, add "Polished". Click the Add Material icon > Select Granite. Click the Name of the newly added Material > Add "Leathered" to the end. Save the Product List.

articles.title: Cancel A Purchase Order
articles.content: Cancel A Purchase Order There may be times when a Purchase Order needs to be canceled. In Moraware inventory, a Purchase Order can be canceled anytime it has an Open status. Canceling a Purchase order is permanent and can not be undone. To cancel a Closed Purchase Order, Re-Open the PO first, then cancel. If a Purchase Order has On-Hand Materials or Sinks, it can not be canceled until the On-Hand Product Status is reverted. If a Purchase Order with Allocated Materials or Sinks is canceled, there is the option to delete the Product or keep it as Wanted. Canceling a Purchase order is permanent and can not be undone. Click to open the Purchase Order Details of any Open PO. Click the Edit icon. Click the Cancel PO icon at the top. Determine if any Allocated Slabs or Sinks are to be deleted or kept as Wanted. Confirm cancellation.

articles.title: Revert A Slab Or Sink Status
articles.content: Revert A Slab Or Sink Status Do you need to change the Status of Slabs or Sinks? If Slabs or Sinks have been marked as a On-Hand or Consumed by accident, or a Job changes, the On-Hand and Consumed Statuses can be reverted. If the Material or Sink was Allocated to a Job Activity, it will remain Allocated after reverting the Status. There are multiple ways to navigate to the Status of a Purchase Order. This article will demonstrate from a Slab View. From a View, click the Status of a Product. Click the Revert Status icon. Confirm the Reset.

articles.title: Purchase Order Views
articles.content: Purchase Order Views Purchase Order Views can be modified to display Orders that are Not Yet Received, All Orders (Any), Incomplete Orders, Closed Orders (Ordered), Received Orders, and Canceled Orders. Go to POs > Customize. Select a Status from the drop-down list > Apply.

articles.title: Change Purchase Order Start Number
articles.content: Change Purchase Order Start Number Do you need to skip or change the number sequence of your Purchase Orders? The next Purchase Order Number to be used can be modified. Changing the next Purchase Order Number will not re-number previous POs, it will only change the numbering of Purchase Orders going forward. Go to Settings > Purchase Order Settings > Next Purchase Order Number. Click the Edit icon. Enter a number that will be the next Purchase Order Number used.

articles.title: Add Serial Numbers
articles.content: Add Serial Numbers Do you have Slabs that need Serial Numbers assigned? Serial Numbers can be assigned when Slab is changed from Wanted to Received, or at any point once the Slab is entered into Moraware Inventory, whether it's Wanted, Ordered, or On-Hand. Serial Numbers can be added by clicking on the Status. The Status is displayed in several places within Inventory, such as Slab Views, Purchase Orders, or a Job Activity. The examples below show some available options. ASSIGN SERIAL NUMBERS AND RECEIVE MATERIAL Click on the Receive button in a Slab View or Job Activity page. Select the Slab to Receive. Click the Edit icon to add Serial Numbers. Enter the Serial Number(s) and Apply. Click the Receive button. ASSIGN SERIAL NUMBERS TO WANTED, ORDERED, OR ON-HAND MATERIAL From a Slab View, click on the Slab Status. Click the Edit icon to add Serial Numbers. Enter the Serial Number(s) and Apply.

articles.title: Delete Or Edit On-Hand Products
articles.content: Delete Or Edit On-Hand Products Need to correct On-Hand Products already in the system? Use the Reconcile feature to manage On-Hand Slabs and Sinks in Moraware Inventory. In a Reconcile View, On-Hand Slabs and Sinks can be deleted, or modified. When removing Slabs or Sinks allocated to a Job Activity, there is the option to create a Wanted Product for that Activity. Removing Slabs or Sink by deleting is permanent and can not be undone. You must have an Administrator Role in Inventory to access the Reconcile feature. See your database Administrator(s) for permissions. DELETE ON-HAND SLABS Go to Settings > Reconcile Slabs > click the Start Reconciling button. From the Reconcile View, click the Delete icon next to any Slab to Remove. DELETE ON-HAND SINKS Go to Settings > Reconcile Sinks > click the Start Reconciling button. Click the Delete icon next to any Sink to Remove. EDIT ON-HAND SLABS OR SINKS Go to Settings > Reconcile Slabs or Reconcile Sinks > click the Start Reconciling button. Click on the underlined Status of a Slab or Sink to edit.

articles.title: Add Products To An Existing Purchase Order
articles.content: Add Products To An Existing Purchase Order Need to add products to an existing Purchase Order that has been closed? Slabs and Sinks can be added to existing PO by Re-Opening the Purchase Order. Go to POs > Click on the Purchase Order to edit. Click the Re-Open icon. Click the Order Slab or Order Sink icon to add.

articles.title: Remove Products From A Closed Purchase Order
articles.content: Remove Products From A Closed Purchase Order Need to remove Products from an existing Purchase Order that has been Closed? Slabs and Sinks can be removed from a Closed PO by Re-Opening the Purchase Order. Slabs and Sinks can only be removed from Purchase Orders if they have not been Received. On-Hand Products are considered Received. If you are trying to Release Slabs or Sinks from a Job/Job Activity, see Release Products From A Job. Go to POs > Click on the Purchase Order to edit. Click the Re-Open icon. Click the Remove Slab or Remove Sink icon to remove items from the Purchase Order.

articles.title: Allocate Products
articles.content: Allocate Products Are you ready to allocate Slabs or Sinks to Jobs? These are referred to as Products in Moraware Inventory. Slabs and Sinks are Allocated to Job via Systemize, and are associated with a Job Activity that can be viewed in Systemize or Inventory. Slabs and Sinks can be Allocated From Inventory, which are Products that are currently unallocated On-Hand, Ordered, or on an Open PO. Or they can be Allocated as Wanted, which are items that are not Ordered or On-Hand. In Systemize, open a Job and scroll to the Job Activities. Click Edit Material in the Material column for the Activity that is associated with the Slab or Sink. ALLOCATE SLABS In Moraware Inventory, Allocate Slabs by selecting either From Inventory or Wanted. When allocating From Inventory, select from the listed Material. When no Filters are applied, all available Materials that are not already Allocated are displayed. Or, use the optional Filters, Material, Color, and/or Bundle. Select any or all of the Filters > click Refresh to apply. Select from the listed Material > click Add. Or, Allocate the Slab as Wanted if the Material needs to be ordered. ALLOCATE SINKS In Moraware Inventory, Allocate Sinks by selecting either From Inventory or Wanted. When allocating From Inventory, select from the listed Sinks. When no Filters are applied, all available Sinks that are not already Allocated are displayed. Or, use the optional Filters, Sink Brand and/or Sink Model. Select any or all of the filters > click Refresh to apply. Select from the listed Sinks > click Add. Or, Allocate the Sink as Wanted if the Sink needs to be ordered.

articles.title: Product Status Definitions
articles.content: Product Status Definitions Not quite sure what some of the terms for Statuses of Products mean in Slab, Sink, and Purchase Order Views in Moraware Inventory? Purchase Orders go through various Statuses as Products are added, ordered, and used. Allocated is a unique Status with its own column, so that the associated Job Name can be displayed. This allows the Job Activity to be opened within Inventory. Wanted: Slabs and Sinks are products Allocated to a Job that have not been Ordered. A Purchase Order has not been created. Ordered: Slabs and Sinks that are part of a Purchase Order that has been Closed. Closed = Ordered Open PO: Slab and Sinks that are on a Purchase Order that has not been Closed. Allocated: A Slab or Sink that has been associated with a Job Activity in a specific Systemize Job. On-Hand: A Slab or Sink that has been Ordered and Received and is in stock, ready to be used. The Product may or may not be Allocated. On-Hand = Received Consumed: A Slab or Sink that was used and is no longer available.

articles.title: Remove Products From A Purchase Order
articles.content: Remove Products From A Purchase Order Need to remove Products from an existing Purchase Order? Slabs and Sinks can be removed from a Purchase Order if they have not been Received. On-Hand Products are considered Received. If you are trying to Remove Slabs or Sinks from a Closed Purchase Order, or if you are trying to Release Slabs or Sinks from a Job/Job Activity, follow the steps in Remove Products From A Closed Purchase Order. Go to POs > Click on the Purchase Order to edit. Click the Remove Slab or Remove Sink icon to remove items from the Purchase Order.

articles.title: Swap Wanted Products For On-Hand
articles.content: Swap Wanted Products For On-Hand Products that have been assigned as Wanted can be swapped with On-Hand Products. When Wanted Material is swapped, it is replaced with Material that is On-Hand. The process of swapping Products is different than Removing. The Wanted Product is deleted and replaced by the selected On-Hand Product. Go to the Job Activity page for a Wanted Product. Click on the Swap icon. Select the On-Hand Product to replace the Wanted Product.

articles.title: Release Products From A Job
articles.content: Release Products From A Job Do you need to change which Job Activity a Product is Allocated to? Slabs and Sinks can be Released from Job Activities if they need to be used somewhere else. Or if they were not Allocated to the correct Job/Job Activity. Wanted Slabs or Sinks can not be Released from a Job Activity, only On-Hand Products. Releasing Slabs or Sinks that are allocated to Job Activities, frees up that Product for use elsewhere, while creating a Wanted Status allocation of that Product still attached to the Job Activity. Click on the Job Name in Allocated To column. Click the Release button from the top menu bar. Select the Slab or Sink to release, then click the Release button again.

articles.title: Add Or Edit On-Hand Products
articles.content: Add Or Edit On-Hand Products Do you have Products that have already been purchased and received? Add On-Hand Slabs and Sinks to Inventory without creating a Purchase Order. Use the Reconcile feature to manage On-Hand Slabs and Sinks. In a Reconcile View, On-Hand Slabs and Sinks can be added and modified. Remnants can be added for pieces not associated with a Job. Indicate Remnant under Size and enter dimensions when adding On-Hand Slabs. You must have an Administrator Role in Inventory to access the Reconcile feature. See your database Administrator(s) for permissions. ADD ON-HAND SLABS Go to Settings > Reconcile Slabs > click the Start Reconciling button. Click Add On-Hand > Enter the Quantity, Material, Color, and any additional fields as needed > click Add. ADD ON-HAND SINKS Go to Settings > Reconcile Sinks > click the Start Reconciling button. Click Add On-Hand > Enter the Quantity, Sink Brand, Sink Model, and Cost/Sink or Notes as needed > click Add. EDIT ON-HAND SLABS OR SINKS Go to Settings > Reconcile Slabs or Reconcile Sinks > click the Start Reconciling button. Click on the underlined Status of a Slab or Sink to edit.

articles.title: Create Purchase Order Forms
articles.content: Create Purchase Order Forms Purchase Order Forms can be created and customized in Inventory. Creating a Purchase Order Form will allow you to create a PDF of a Purchase Order to print or email. New Forms can be created, or XML files can be imported. You must have Administrator privileges to make these changes. If you are not, contact the Admin User in your company. Go to Settings > Purchase Order Settings > Forms. Click Create from the top menu. To create a new Form, enter a name then Save. To import an existing XML file, click the Import PO Form icon. Click inside any Field to edit. To move cells, click, hold and drag to a new location. Two blue arrows and orange lines will indicate the the Field will be placed.

articles.title: Re-Open A Purchase Order
articles.content: Re-Open A Purchase Order When a Purchase Order is Closed, it's status changes to Ordered. There may be situations when a Purchase Order that needs to be Re-Opened. Re-Opening a Purchase Order will clear the Ordered Date and change the Status to Open. Your User Role must have Permission to Re-Open a PO. Check with your Admin User for access. Go to POs > click on a Purchase Order Number to Re-Open. Click the Re-Open icon > confirm Re-open.

articles.title: Add A Logo To Purchase Order Forms
articles.content: Add A Logo To Purchase Order Forms Adding your company logo and contact information to a Purchase Order Form results in a professional look. If you have already added a logo in Systemize, it will be listed as an option in the Header Logo Field. Your logo must be saved as a BMP, GIF, JPG, JPEG or PNG. PDF images can not be uploaded. Go to Settings > Purchase Order Settings > Purchase Order Forms. Click on the name of the Form to modify. Click in the header Field. Select a Header Position, then the drop down menu next to Logo. Choose an existing file, or select New Logo File to upload a new file. Add additional details like Company Name, Address, and Field Formatting.

articles.title: Remove Or Replace Slab Image Files
articles.content: Remove Or Replace Slab Image Files Have you uploaded image files in Inventory that need to be changed? Images attached to Slabs or Remnants can be removed and replaced. Editing the Slab Image is also where the Reference Only indicator is located. Access Edit Slab Image in Slab Views, Job Activity pages, and individual Purchase Order pages, by clicking the Status of the Material. BEFORE YOU BEGIN: Save images of slabs on your computer or in a cloud storage location of your choice, naming images according to what they are, to make it easier to search later on. Save images as BMP, GIF, JPEG, or PNG formats. The limit on the size of the file to be uploaded is 30 MB. REMOVE SLAB IMAGE Click on the Status of the Slab or Remnant. Click the Delete image icon > Save. REPLACE SLAB IMAGE AFTER REMOVING Add a new image by clicking on the Add Image icon. Locate the image on your computer or cloud storage > Save.

articles.title: Add Inventory Slab Images
articles.content: Add Inventory Slab Images Thumbnail images can be added to Slabs and Remnants in Moraware Inventory, providing a quick visual in Slab Views, Job Activity pages, individual Purchase Order pages, and when adding On-Hand or Wanted Material. Images can be added by clicking on the Status in any of these Views. BEFORE YOU BEGIN: Save images of slabs on your computer or in a cloud storage location of your choice, naming images according to what they are, to make it easier to search later on. Save images as BMP, GIF, JPEG, or PNG formats. The limit on the size of the file to be uploaded is 30 MB. Click on the Status of the Slab or Remnant. Click the Add Slab Image icon. Locate the image on your computer or cloud storage > Save.

articles.title: Create An L-Shaped Remnant
articles.content: Create An L-Shaped Remnant Material tracked by square feet or square meters, can only enter a Length and Width when creating a Remnant. There is no way to enter unique shape measurements. Note the shape and/or additional dimensions in the Notes Field as a Remnant is created to track L-shaped or unusual shapes. Start on the Job Activity page that has the original Slab assigned. Consume the Slab if it has not been already. Click on the status Consumed to edit the Slab> click the Split Slab icon at the top of the window. Click the Add Remnant button. Choose By Dimensions, and enter longest length and width in the Measurement field. Then add additional information in the Notes Field. Click the Add Image icon to add a photo of the Remnant if needed > Save.

articles.title: Inactivate Or Delete Inventory Label Forms
articles.content: Inactivate Or Delete Inventory Label Forms Label Forms are used when printing Slab Labels. Forms can be edited at any point, and they can be inactivated if they are no longer needed. Label Forms can also be deleted, but this action is permanent and deleted Forms can not be recovered. If a Form is no longer used, we recommend setting it to Inactive instead of deleting. An inactive Form can be quickly activated if it needs to be used again, saving the time of having to recreate it entirely. Inactive Forms will appear greyed out on the Labels page, but will not be displayed when selecting which Label Form to print. INACTIVATE/ACTIVATE A LABEL FORM Go to Settings > Labels > click on the Name of the Form to inactivate/activate. Click the Edit Form Template icon. Check Inactive to inactivate the Form, uncheck to activate the Form. DELETE A LABEL FORM: THIS ACTION IS PERMANENT AND IRREVERSIBLE Go to Settings > Labels > click on the Name of the Form to inactivate/activate. Click inside each Form Field > click the Delete icon > Save. Repeat for each Field. Click the Edit Form Template icon > click the Delete icon. Confirm action to Delete the Form. This action can not be undone.

articles.title: Auto-Generate Serial Numbers
articles.content: Auto-Generate Serial Numbers Serial Numbers for Slabs can be auto-generated or manually entered when viewing individual Slab Details. Slab Details can be accessed by clicking on Slab Status in Slab Views, in Purchase Orders, or when Receiving Material. When auto-generating Serial Numbers, the next available number in the sequence is used. The start number for Serial Numbers is entered under Settings. Although the auto-generate feature will not create a duplicate number, when manually entering a number, there is no warning if you enter a number that already exists. This was designed to allow for partial Slabs to retain the Serial Number of the original Slab it was cut from. When adding Serial Numbers, auto-generate all the numbers, manually enter the numbers, or use a combination of both. From any View that shows the Slab Status, click the underlined Status. Click the Set Serial Number button. Check Generate Serial Numbers at the bottom to auto-generate all Serial Numbers. Or manually enter some numbers and check Generate next to individual Slabs to auto-generate only the ones specified > Apply > Save. When clicking the status of a single Slab, the option to auto-generate appears directly in the Slab Details.

articles.title: Set Serial Number Auto-Generate Start
articles.content: Set Serial Number Auto-Generate Start When auto-generating Serial Numbers for Slabs, you set the start number. This number can be changed at any time. Once entered, the sequence will continue. The Next Slab Serial Number page always shows the next number that will be used as numbers are generated. Only numbers are accepted, no letters or other characters are accepted. When updating the Next Slab Serial Number, the number entered will be the next number used. Go to Settings > Next Slab Serial Number. Click the Update icon > enter the next number for the auto-generated number to use > Save.

articles.title: Import Label Forms
articles.content: Import Label Forms Moraware Inventory Label Forms can be shared by exporting and importing XML files. If you have a file with the extension ".xml", you can import it directly into a Label Form. The new Form will automatically be named the same as the imported file. Currently no other file formats can be imported. Go to Settings > Labels > Create. Click the Import icon in the top bar. Select an XML file to import > Import. The Form will import and open. If needed, rename by clicking the Edit icon across from Form Template Info.

articles.title: Format Label Form Fields
articles.content: Format Label Form Fields Label Forms are made up of individual Fields. Each Field can have unique formatting applied. Label Form Fields can be edited individually or as a group. When editing multiple Fields at once, all selected Fields will have the selections applied. Display Name: The Name of a Filed is fixed and cannot be changed, but a Display Name will print what is entered instead. An example where this is useful is if the Name is long, a shorter version or abbreviation can be entered as a Display Name. A Display Name only applies to the Label Form where it is entered. If left blank, the Name will be used. Field Width: By default this is set to 1. When two Fields are on the same line, and both are set to 1, they will each take up the same amount of space on the line. If one Field is set to 2, it will be twice as wide as a Field set to 1, and so on. Hide Field When Blank: when checked, this option will not print the Field if it is empty. Cell: refers to the entire Field, both the Label and the Value. The Cell has unique properties related to where the Label appears, across the top of the value, on the left or right, or not at all. It can have a border all the way around the entire Cell, and also an inner border to split the Label from the Value. Leave any or all options blank to use the default settings. Label: refers to the Name of the Field, like "Material". Select the Font, Font Style (Bold, Underlined, Italic), Text Color, and Background. Leave any or all options blank to use the default settings. Value: refers to the unique information from your database. In the Label Form, it will appear empty, since each Value is pulled for each item being labeled. For the example of a Field named "Material", the Value that will appear when printed will be whatever Material has been selected for each item, like Granite. Select the Font, Font Style (Bold, Underlined, Italic), Text Color, and Background. Leave any or all options blank to use the default settings. EDIT INDIVIDUAL FIELDS Go to Settings > Labels > Click on the Name of the Label Form to edit. Click inside any Field > click Cell, Label, or Value for options. EDIT MULTIPLE FIELDS Go to Settings > Labels > Click on the Name of the Label Form to edit. Click the Edit icon < Click the Select All icon or click inside individual Field to select > click Next > click Cell, Label, or Value for options.

articles.title: Change Cost Group Colors
articles.content: Change Cost Group Colors Using Cost Groups helps organize your Material costs, and speeds up entering information. There are two ways to change the Colors in a Cost Group. Change the Colors in a Cost Group under Cost Groups. Or, change the Cost Group a Color belongs to next to an individual Color. EDIT VIA COST GROUPS LISTS Go to Settings > Product List > Edit Product List. Click on Materials > select a brand. Click on the Assigned Colors for any Cost Group. Check or uncheck Colors to add or remove from the Group. EDIT VIA COLOR DROP-DOWN MENU Go to Settings > Product List > Edit Product List. Click on Materials > select a brand. Scroll to an individual Color and select from the drop-down menu.

articles.title: Add Cost Groups & Cost Lists
articles.content: Add Cost Groups & Cost Lists Once Products have been added, enable Cost Groups and a Cost List to keep them organized. Enable Cost Groups and a Cost List, then add Group Names and Costs. Individual prices can also be added for any Color. ENABLE COST GROUPS & A COST LIST Go to Settings > Product List > Edit Product List. Click Customize next to Cost Settings. Check Include Cost Lists and Cost Groups. Select which Thicknesses and Sizes to apply the changes. CREATE COST GROUPS AND ADD COLORS If using Cost Groups, click Add Cost Groups and enter group names, one per line. Enter prices for each Group. Click on the underlined Assigned Colors to assign Colors to each Cost Group. Select from the drop-down list, or click the Multiple button to select several Colors. Enter prices for the Cost Groups and they will be assigned to the selected Colors. ENTER PRICES If you are not using Cost Groups, enter a Color cost manually under Colors.
